direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve the head of the queue but handle the empty queue case differently.
Both methods interact with the head of the queue, but poll removes the element while peek does not.
Both methods involve operations on the head of the queue, but remove throws an exception if the queue is empty.
Both methods access elements in the queue, but get allows access to any element by index.
Both methods interact with the queue's elements and can affect the queue's state.
Both methods can affect the queue's state, and clear resets the queue which can affect peek's behavior.
Both methods involve accessing elements in the queue, but iterator provides a way to iterate over all elements.
Both methods can be affected by the size of the queue, and size provides information about the queue's state.
